meanings.definition: To continue to exist or live
meanings.sent1: After the storm, the small plant managed to subsister in the harsh conditions.
meanings.sent2: Despite the challenges, the old tree was able to subsister for many years.
meanings.sent3: The little seedling tried to subsister in the rocky soil, but it needed more sunlight.
meanings.sent4: In the desert, only the most resilient plants can subsister through the scorching heat.
meanings.sent5: The tiny fish had to subsister in the shallow pond until the rains came.

meanings.sent1: The subsister of the shipwreck was grateful to be rescued by the passing boat.
meanings.sent2: The lone subsister of the ancient tribe held onto their traditions.
meanings.sent3: The last subsister of the extinct species was carefully protected in the sanctuary.
meanings.sent4: As the only subsister of the family, she carried on their legacy with pride.
meanings.sent5: The subsister of the battle emerged victorious, standing tall among the fallen.

meanings.definition: To remain in force or effect
meanings.sent1: The law will subsister until a new one is enacted by the council.
meanings.sent2: The treaty between the two nations will subsister for another decade.
meanings.sent3: The magic spell began to subsister, causing unexpected consequences.
meanings.sent4: The tradition continued to subsister despite changing times and customs.
meanings.sent5: The old belief system started to subsister as people embraced new ideas.
